title: Pokhran Fort
review: Pokhran Fort is one of the famous fort in Jaisalmer. this is partially a hotel. movies are also captured here like Parmanu. very old fort.

title: Cute place just a little away from Jodhpur
review: Pokaran was where India tested its first nuclear weaponry! Imagine the stories attached to it! As per Wikipedia, Pokhran-II was the series of five nuclear bomb test explosions conducted by India at the Indian Army's Pokhran Test Range in May 1998. It was the second Indian nuclear test; the first test, code-named Smiling Buddha, was conducted in May 1974. Take a little detour between Jaisalmer and Jodhpur and try visiting this fort.

title: Famous
review: Presently everyone knows what is Pokhran and many history, stories and movies also made. Fort has lots of information available related to Pokhran.

title: Decaying legacy
review: A once beautiful fort but totally in disrepair.  Very poorly looked after, little or no signage.  The so called "heritage" hotel seemed shut with a few people loitering around, wasn't sure if they were staff ... just poorly looked after place. The old strong walls have kept the place still standing and that's about it.

title: Old fort
review: I went to Pokhran to see the Nuclear Test Site but this fort was a surprise addition. a good fort with ancient things preserved in it of Raja Ajmal and Baba ramdev Pir.

title: Pokhran
review: If you are patriot then you must go a visit this place as this place had made a history for Indians..

title: Excellent place to visit
review: The fort is partially converted into the hotel where the hindi movie Parmanu was shot. It is nice and quite place to visit.

title: A good spot to see while inter-city travels
review: Pokhran gained overnight popularity after the nuclear tests. The fort is small but decently maintained.

title: AWesome fort from the outside, try the Chicken Biryani at the fort's hotel
review: An amazing fort from the outside. Huge and bright. Nothing much to see or do here to. Check out the Hotel and its a pretty place. A garden with a  pool. order a chicken boryani and its the best you would have had in the state. Wonder how royal it would be living here for a day!

title: A must visit if you are in Jaisalmer
review: A few kms drive from Jaisalmer.. it's a brush with history well preserved. It's an achitectural gem and a camera person's delight! There are tickets for parking and entering the fort.

title: Nothing Special / Waste of Time
review: Extremely non maintained fort.

title: Lovely
review: Interesting historical building, quite small but beautiful architecture and well maintained, with lovely gardens.

title: A nice little fort
review: If you are travelling through Rajistan and visiting the major forts, such as the Red Fort, Amber Fort, Jaisalmer, kumbhalgarh fort etc, then you can give this one a miss.  It is surrounded by markets and quite small.  It is not well maintained and has no interpretive signage etc. Unless you have a specific interest in this fort or need a leg stretch after hours on THOSE ROADS... give it a miss

title: Great photo opportunity
review: While the fort is not big but the caretaker there helped us click some of the best family snaps which we could have taken in the midst of a fort. Well maintained, quite a bit of history it's a small detour but we felt was worth it. The architecture is restored and well maintained which makes for great snaps

title: Average Fort
review: You will find forts present in all parts of Rajasthan, and this is the fort at Pokhran. Historically the maharaja had occupied it, but today its partly a hotel and the rest is not much to see. There is one section which is like a small museum containing historical artifacts used by royalty and another part which is the surrounding are like the walls and canons at the top of it. You will not find many people around here because it is not one of the famous forts. But if you are interested in history and are visiting this place you can visit it.

title: Little Silent fort
review: During our way to Jodhpur from Jaisalmer, we (me & my wife) have visited this Historical Little fort of Pokhran city. This was  a average fort with reddish color.

title: good stop between Jodhpur and jaisalmer
review: Pokharan is a small detour from the highway but its a good stop to take to have lunch and a break in the journey.

title: Miss this  one!!!
review: Nothing special.

title: D-Tour on way to Jodhpur from Jaisalmer
review: This is very poorly managed fort, its just a quick d-tour on the way from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur. Not good to spend to much time on this area, do not take a guide as they charge for nothing. Its just a quick visit if you are okay to take a dtour

title: Ill maintained fort
review: Pokhran was not a kingdom but fiefdom, a part of  thae palace in now hotel. The fort is one of the worst maintained fort, you can see old items, clothes, weapon on display. Find a guide, pay him RS 50 to know the history. #0 minutes is needed to see the fort. You can take a detour on the way from Jodhpur to Jaisalmer.

title: not a big fort, only ok
review: there's not much to see in this fort really. especially if you've seem some nice ones in rajasthan before...

title: Good fort converted to a comfortable stay
review: We stopped by this place on our way to jaisalmer - we had lunch here. The restaurant serves authentic (awesome) Indian food and the service was amazing too :-) We had a great time here.

title: Simple Fort in center of city
review: Simple fort with less of tourist around, so you can walk around comfortable. Half of it has been converted into a hotel. It is located in the center of city. Not many touts around to disturb you. Nothing great about this fort.

title: Interesting find
review: This place was on our way to Jaisalmer and was an interesting find. The fort can be done in half an hour.

title: 14th century fort
review: This fort is also one of good and maintained fort in rajasthan. In this fort one  museum is there, in which king family collections must to view. i.e. clothes, armory, painting, handicrafts etc.

title: Fort
review: The place is associated with India becoming a nuclear power. Your local taxi driver/guide would dissuade to go there but one must visit this place when in Pokhran. Small but well built fort but not well maintained. Rather ill maintained if you reach the rooftop. Has a museum and few small temples inside.

title: Ramdevra - Pokhran trip
review: Pokhran is famous as a place where India conducted its nuclear tests. and Ramdevpir 's childhood memories

title: Historical fort
review: Interesting historical building; quite small and easy to visit and not too much to see. The visit was spolit by the lack of upkeep; people had used sheltered corners as a toilet and generally it was very dusty. It just added to the historical value of Rajesthan, between Bikanerand Jaisal mer. The village looked interesting but our driver did not stop.

title: Beautiful place to stop
review: We were on the road from Jodphur to Jaisalmer and stopped at this beautiful fort. Guided by a local who spoke good English and who showed us around explaining everything in detail. Then has a short guide of the grounds to the adjacent hotel. If you are driving the six hours between these two cities the fort makes a welcome break.

title: Dissapointing stop on the way to Jodpur
review: It was on out itinerary, so we stopped here. Would have spent the extra time in Jodpur. Fort is beeing slowly restaured but it really has nothing to offer.

title: Takes you back in time
review: There is a lot more to Pokhran then just our nuclear test. The palace is beautiful and seems to take you back in the old times. You dont really need a guide to take a tour until and unless you want to know the history...

title: A quaint little fortress
review: While not as large or inexpressive as its  larger cousins at Jodhpur & Jaisalmer, the fortress cum  chalet at Pokhran too is a nice side trip. Sit in the lawns & take in the sights. They also have accommodation for those who are interested.

title: a night in the past
review: A small fort with beautifull rooms in the old ways style.You feel the memories of the past.A nice stop between Bikaner and Jaisalmer

title: Birth place of saint ramdevra.
review: The fort displays very old utensils , portraits of the saint & royal family . A royal sword weighing 40 kg.which makes u imagine the built of the royal king who could fight with a 40 kg sword. he was really strong & almighty.There is a hotel inside the fort managed by the royal family where guest can stay in royal comfort.

title: A small Fort of Rathores also known as "Bala Garh"
review: Every Fort in Rajasthan has a name and so does this Fort - Its know as "Bala Garh". Its located right on the main road that connects Jodhpur with Jaisalmer and Barmer. We stopped by here while returning from Jaisalmer in 1997. Pokhran is also famous for Terracotta work (Decorative Earthen pots) and Test Range where Nuclear Tests are carried out and its also used for Fire Power demonstration. The Balagrah Fort was house to Royal family of Champawat Clans, who were also known as Rathores. This Fort was built more for residential purpose and does not have any complex or strategic boundaries / walls for defense.

title: Awesome!!!
review: Nice place worth a visit not alone only with friends where in you can enjoy on ur own with ur group. u will find people at jaisalmer commenting otherwise bt dont listen to it its definately worth giving a shot. it is completely a relaxing place and very romantic. you are treated as some king the fort gives such a feel. though their was no dress code of the staff as you expect at heritage place, nt maintained properly and no proper guards. but that can be neglected.

title: Good fort
review: A very good fort as usual not being maintained at all by the authorities. Hope people start working and maintaining these forts so our next generations see these places.

title: 14-Th Century Fort
review: Well preserved fort also called Balagarh, is one good place to visit if you are visiting near by places.

title: nice attraction
review: surrounded by salt ranges, nice museum inside, not the best attraction of rajasthan, depicts a combination of Rajput and Mughal architecture

title: worth the drive...!!
review: we drove till Pokhran , not expecting much, but the Fort was well maintained, as part of it has been converted to a Heritage Hotel, the gardens are lovely, we had a nice guide who doubled as a photographer and took some candid photos..he was extremely well informed about the place and took his time in explaining everything in detail.. Worth Visiting..!!!

title: Great fort but not much to see
review: I went from Bikaner to Jaisalmer by car . I was told by my driver that its very nice fort. I stop her only half an hour is very beautiful and if you are more interested in museum you can spent more time and know more about history of Rajasthan.

title: LOVELY WELL MAINTAINED FORT
review: It is a beautiful fort, with an excellent museum. Small though, the gardens are lovely. Do take a guide to understand the history. The hotel is part of the fort and worth a visit. We did not stop for a meal, but spent time going through the museum.

title: Good well maintained... and worth the drive
review: We all know pokhran for one reason...    I was told by my driver that this fort was worth spending time.  And well, yes.  It came across as a small beautiful, well maintained and clean fort along with a museum.  We took a guide here so that we could know about the history. A part of the fort has now been converted into Hertiage Hotel, we saw the rooms and they were really really magestic.  The gardens are lovely.  An hour is sufficient to roam about and to learn about.  Dont miss.   There is also a seller of pokhran clay works.  We did buy some as memories.

title: Huge and beautiful
review: An ancient masterpiece which is well planned against enemy attacks, nice and beautiful architecture and well maintained. Probably one of the best forts and must watch on your trip to jaisalmer.

title: A wonderful experience
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this beautiful, well maintained Fort which also has a Museum on Rajasthani history and culture. The Fort is a spectacular golden structure, and is definitely well worth a visit. Highly recommended.

title: Remarkable, well preserved fort in the desert of Rajasthan
review: Fort Pokran or Pokaran is a 14th century citadel (Balagarth) in the Thar Desert of the Rajasthan.

title: Watch if you are around
review: If you are travelling by road from Bikaner to Jaisalmer then just about 40 to 60 kms before you will find the famous Pokhran where the Nuclear Test was conducted by BJP Govt. under Atal Ji's leadership. You can visit at the gate of the place but not allowed beyond that gate but instead you can visit this Fort here. Take a guide. There is a Dhaba on main road here where the food is very tasty. You can come to this place and go back if you are at Jaisalmer. The famous song Zihale Maskin of Gulami was shot here at one of the set of chatries which you can easily identify.

title: Decaying legacy
review: A once beautiful fort but totally in disrepair.  Very poorly looked after, little or no signage.  The so called "heritage" hotel seemed shut with a few people loitering around, wasn't sure if they were staff ... just poorly looked after place. The old strong walls have kept the place still standing and that's about it.

review: Pokaran was where India tested its first nuclear weaponry! Imagine the stories attached to it! As per Wikipedia, Pokhran-II was the series of five nuclear bomb test explosions conducted by India at the Indian Army's Pokhran Test Range in May 1998. It was the second Indian nuclear test; the first test, code-named Smiling Buddha, was conducted in May 1974. Take a little detour between Jaisalmer and Jodhpur and try visiting this fort.

review: If you are patriot then you must go a visit this place as this place had made a history for Indians..

title: Lovely
review: Interesting historical building, quite small but beautiful architecture and well maintained, with lovely gardens.
